revised_title: The Synthesis of Fats in the Intestinal Mucosa
tldr: The author investigates the synthesis of fats in the intestinal mucosa and the role of pancreatic juice in fat absorption. They found that the synthesis of neutral fat occurs in the intestinal villi before the lymph reaches the mesenteric lacteals. The experiments also showed that pancreatic extracts have a marked ability to release fatty acids from soap, which may protect the body from the toxic effects of soaps in the circulation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Lipid Metabolism
